DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable indicator that describes if patient has any known ophthalmological conditions.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A surgical specialty concerned with the structure and function of the eye and the medical and surgical treatment of its defects and diseases._A state of being, such as a state of health.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A surgical specialty concerned with the structure and function of the eye and the medical and surgical treatment of its defects and diseases.:A state of being, such as a state of health.

Concepts.definition: A medical specialty concerned with the structure and function of the eye and the medical and surgical treatment of its defects and diseases.
A state of being, such as a state of health.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex Question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known ophthalmological conditions as follows: Intra-ocular pressure greater than 21 mmHg, or uncontrolled glaucoma (irrespective of intra-ocular pressure); Current or past history of central serous retinopathy or retinal vein occlusion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have known ophth
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known ophthalmological conditions?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or current evidence/risk of retinal vein occlusion (RVO)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or current evidence/risk of retinal vein occlusion (RVO) or central serous retinopathy (CSR)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known macular degeneration, uncontrolled glaucoma, or cataracts

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any Retinal Deposits?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known ophthalmologic conditions such as, current or past history of retinal vein occlusion (RVO) or central serous retinopathy (CSR)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known indicated significant ophthalmologic conditions

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or current evidence/risk of retinal vein occlusion (RVO) or retinal pigment epithelial detachment (RPED)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known risk factors for ocular toxicity, consisting of any of the following: History of serous retinopathy or History of retinal vein occlusion (RVO) or Evidence of ongoing serous retinopathy or RVO at screening?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient  have history of OR evidence of retinal pathology on Ophthalmologic examination that is considered a risk factor for neurosensory retinal detachment, central serous chorioretinopathy, retinal vein occlusion (RVO), or neurovascular macular degeneration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient  have history of or evidence of retinal pathology on Ophthalmologic examination that is considered a risk factor for neurosensory retinal detachment, central serous chorioretinopathy, retinal vein occlusion (RVO), or neurovascular macular degeneration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any of the following ophthalmologic conditions: Current or past history of central serous retinopathy, current or past history of retinal vein occlusion or retinal detachment, or uncontrolled glaucoma

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has no evidence of retinal pathology on ophthalmologic examination; or neurosensory retinal detachment, RVO, or neovascular macular degeneration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of retinal vein occlusion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active ocular disorder or abnormality likely to significantly increase the risk of eye toxicity, such as history of or current evidence of central serous retinopathy or retinal vascular occlusion; active wet, age-related macular degeneration; diabetic retinopathy with macular edema; uncontrolled glaucoma (per local standard of care); corneal pathology such as keratitis, keratoconjunctivitis, keratopathy, corneal abrasion, and inflammation or ulceration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of retinal pathology on ophthalmologic examination; or neurosensory retinal detachment, RVO, or neovascular macular degeneration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient currently have central serous retinopathy (CSR) or retinal pigment epithelial detachment of any grade?

DataElement.changeDescription: 6/24/14 created for Theradex eligibility CRF. jc
